lifeEventId.description: A reference number for a life event.

periodStartDate.description: The first date in the claim period.

periodEndDate.description: The end date of the claim period.

htbTransfer.description: Details about Help to Buy funds.

htbTransferInForPeriod.description: The total amount of Help to Buy funds in the account during the claim period.

htbTransferTotalYTD.description: The total amount of Help to Buy funds in the account in the tax year to date.

inboundPayments.description: Details about qualifying deposits and account balance.

newSubsForPeriod.description: The total value of new qualifying deposits paid in to the account during the claim period.

newSubsYTD.description: The total value of new qualifying deposits paid in to the account during the tax year to date.

totalSubsForPeriod.description: The total amount in the account during the claim period that qualifies for a bonus payment.

totalSubsYTD.description: The total amount in the account during the tax year to date that qualifies for a bonus payment.

bonusDueForPeriod.description: The total bonus payment amount due for the claim period.

totalBonusDueYTD.description: The total bonus payment amount due for the tax year to date.

bonusPaidYTD.description: The total bonus payment that has already been claimed and paid in the tax year to date.

claimReason.description: The reason the bonus payment was claimed.

supersededBy.description: The transactionId of a bonus request which supersedes this one.

supersede.description: Supersede bonus payment by requesting for an additional bonus amount or recover an overpaid amount.

automaticRecoveryAmount.description: This is used to confirm the amount due to HMRC from the LISA manager. If the superseded transaction result is a less than zero, you must give the automatic recovery amount. This is so that HMRC can calculate the amount to collect from the LISA manager. Leave it blank if there are no funds available. HMRC will recover overpaid funds from the LISA investor.

originalTransactionId.description: The transactionId of the original bonus affected by the correction or recovery. This is used together with the originalBonusDueForPeriod to make sure the right bonus transaction is replaced.

originalBonusDueForPeriod.description: This is how much was in the bonusDueForPeriod in the original bonus request.

transactionResult.description: The amount to be added to or recovered from the original bonus. This is used to confirm the outcome of a correction. You must calculate the new bonus amount due for the period minus the old bonus amount due for the period and give this result.

reason.description: Used to confirm the outcome of a correction. You must give the outcome of the superseded bonus claim. This can be either an additional bonus amount due or the recovery of an amount from the bonus.
